ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.online

Class OnlineHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.online.OnlineHelper

  • public class OnlineHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class in which all our back end web based service functions are located. OnlineHelper provides interfaces with the web server to obtain, edit and retrieve information from. This class is based off of code found here:https://github.com/rayzhangcl/ESDemo

    • Constructor Detail

      • OnlineHelper

        public OnlineHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • insertStory

        public void insertStory(Story story)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        java.io.IOException
        insertStory is used to insert a story into our webserver. However, it is also used to update a story because of how the webserver works. The story inserted should have a unique id before being inserted. As our webserver only allows one instance of an object with certain type and id inserting an object with an already existing id will overwrite it. To check if there is an Id that has been taken you can use the checkId method.
        Parameters:
        story - is the story that is to be inserted or overwritten
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        java.io.IOException

      • getStory

        public Story getStory(int storyId)
        Gets the story by the id from our server. An Id should be unique to that story object. All ids are generated by looking at the title and author of a story. If an id is not in the server then the resulting Story object should be NULL.
        Parameters:
        storyId - is the id in which we are searching for ( should be unique also)
        Returns:
        the story object with the associated id

      • getAllStories

        public java.util.ArrayList<Story> getAllStories()
        This method is used to get ALL stories in our web server. Warning: this can be very slow if stories contain many pictures and media, or if there are a lot of stories.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList which contains all stories in the webserver

      • getAllStoryTitlesIdAuthor

        public java.util.ArrayList<Story> getAllStoryTitlesIdAuthor()
                                                     throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                                                            java.io.IOException
        Obtains all stories from the server but is only a partial representation of the object. Will search only the storyTitle, author and Id of a story and return only those fields. This is why getFields method is used for each ElasticSearchReponse This method is used to quickly find all the different stories in our server without having to also downloading all the potentially large media associated with it
        Returns:
        an ArraList of partial stories with only the author, title and id fields filled in
        Throws:
        org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
        java.io.IOException

      • checkId

        public boolean checkId(int id)
                throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                       java.io.IOException
        checks if there is already a story with the same id in our database This function can be used to check for a storyId already on the system to prevent the case of accidental overwriting. Story Ids are obtained by hashing a string that is the title and author combined. Method is mainly used when the user wants to publish a story to ensure that they know if a story will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        id - int value which is our story id ( should be unique)
        Returns:
        true if a story with id exists, else false
        Throws:
        org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
        java.io.IOException

      • searchsearchStories

        public java.util.ArrayList<Story> searchsearchStories(java.lang.String search)
                                               throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                                                      java.io.IOException
        This method searches our web server for the input string on fields author and story. We used the input string "search" to in an elastic search query for fields storyTitle and also author to find hits that match the "search" string. Right now this method is used for our searching function in the online story mode browser. Users will type in keywords which will become the input parameter to this method. For Example searchsearchStories("David Fight") will search the stories that contain "David" and "Fight" within the title and author fields.
        Parameters:
        search - input string
        Returns:
        return a list of stories with input string in the author or story
        Throws:
        org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteStories

        public void deleteStories(int storyId)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        deleteStories deletes ALL stories with the same story ID. If there were a case where there was more than one story with the same ID (which should not happen) ALL stories with the same ID will be deleted from our web server. As of right now this method is not used in the main program yet, but should be implemented to let users delete published stories from the web server.
        Parameters:
        storyId - the id of the story that is to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
